results.title: Holidays pay
results.creator_credit: Tony Paice, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Victorian Tourism Commission
results.brief_description: Provides a look at tourism in Victoria and the ways in which the tourist industry provides employment for a diverse range of people.

results.title: Going outside: to play, to imagine, to learn
results.creator_credit: Rick Cavaggion and Open College of Further Education (S. Aust.)
results.brief_description: Outlines ways in which teachers can develop children’s awareness of the natural environment. In a bush setting, five to eleven-year-olds role play the Dam Conflict Game, learning how to become involved in an issue and how to communicate their feelings.

results.title: You've got to start somewhere
results.creator_credit: Chris Warner, Maureen McCarthy and Trout Films
results.brief_description: Focuses on a multicultural project at Ferntree Gully Primary School to show what teachers at schools with low migrant populations can do to put the philosophy of education in a multicultural society into practice.

results.title: Our fragile coast: The Coast, a question of balance
results.creator_credit: David Hughes and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: The first half of this compilation tape focuses on erosion and deposition at Port Campbell, the Gippsland Lakes and Port Phillip, to be used in conjunction with the Earth in Action topic of the Year 12 Geography course; the second shows how competing human interests could destroy the coastal ecology.

results.title: Tech Talk. Episodes 19 & 20.
results.creator_credit: John Kyle, Allenog Pty Ltd and Channel 0\28
results.brief_description: A compilation tape containing eight programmes designed to help young people in their carrer choices. There is also a segment on survival skills. Presented by Michael Shildberger, the topics covered are as follows:- surveyor, spray painter, painter and decorator, being out of work-the parents angle, computers - working in the industry, computers - the new age, florist and how to keep that job.

results.title: Leah; Water rats; Alison; Tracey
results.creator_credit: Sabina Baltrukomis and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: A compilation tape consisting of four programmes designed to promote discussion in the area of human relations. 1. Leah. Concerns the feelings of an adolescent girl in regard to her alcoholic father who embarrasses her in front of her friends. 2. Water rats. Looks at the peer pressure exerted amongst a group of adolescents to conform to the group’s standards. 3. Alison. Looks at the problems of an adolescent girl who cannot adjust to her single father’s need to have adult female companionship. 4 Tracey. Considers the situation of an adolescent girl subjected to pressure by her domineering father to perform well academically.

results.title: Fatness, foods, fads (compilation)
results.brief_description: Fatness, foods and fads outlines the 5 food groups and examines the fallacies of diets such as the Israeli army diet, the no carbohydrate diet, the grapefruit diet and the macrobiotic diet. 2. “Energy, food and exercise” shows how to achieve a proper balance of food and exercise for particular needs. 3.”Whats cooking” highlights the health problems that abound in the unhygienic kitchen and poses solutions. Compared by Andrew Daddo.

results.title: Energy Conservation in the Home
results.creator_credit: Dept of Minerals and Energy AV Workshop
results.brief_description:
“Energy conservation in the home” provides useful information on the ways in which energy can be saved within the household.

See also Related Title 325491 “Victoria’s energy”; uses stills to analyse Victoria’s energy position during 1980-81.

results.title: Punkline
results.creator_credit: Tony Stevens, Sue Davis and Kali Productions
results.brief_description: Shot at the Crystal Ballroom and Festival Hall during performances of the B 52’s, The Cure, La Femme and The Models, this film provides an observation not of the New Wave performers, but of the people who go to see them. Soundtrack from a tape by Equal Local.

results.title: Versatility in glass
results.brief_description:
Public relations film outlining the nature of glass: how it is made; how it can be used in its many and varied forms for decoration, safety and protection in the home, industry and transportation.
Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.
